title: Circle email-members have still access to a shared folder/file after they are removed from the circle

profile.name: Nextcloud
profile.about: Access, share and protect your files, calendars, contacts, communication & more at home and in your enterprise.

vulnerability_information:
If a email-address is added to a circle, the email user has still access after the email-address is removed from the circle.
Requirements
-------
circles app and share by mail app enabled

Steps to reproduce
-------------
1. add an email address to a circle
2. share a folder/file with the circle
3. remove the email address from the circle
4. try to access the link that is sent to the email address

email user has still access!

Additional information
----------
For every circle share is a non user specific link token created. this token is sent to the email-members.
An other problem is, that if you have forced password usage for link shares and share by mail shares, this link is still accessible without a password. 

Tested with:
Nextcloud 15.0.10
Circles 0.16.9
share by mail 1.5.0

## Impact

A email-member that is removed from a circle
vulnerability_information_html:
If a email-address is added to a circle, the email user has still access after the email-address is removed from the circle.

Requirements

circles app and share by mail app enabled

Steps to reproduce

  1. add an email address to a circle
  2. share a folder/file with the circle
  3. remove the email address from the circle
  4. try to access the link that is sent to the email address

email user has still access!

Additional information

For every circle share is a non user specific link token created. this token is sent to the email-members.
An other problem is, that if you have forced password usage for link shares and share by mail shares, this link is still accessible without a password.

Tested with:
Nextcloud 15.0.10
Circles 0.16.9
share by mail 1.5.0

Impact

A email-member that is removed from a circle

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us!

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 72 hours, usually much faster. For obvious reasons we'd like to ask you to not disclose this issue to any other party.

activities.message:
Hello,

Thanks for your report, and I can confirm that this is currently the normal behavior of sharing a file to a group of email users via Circles. 
Sharing to a Circle will generate a unique key/single share link that will then be shared to every mail address invited to the Circle.

I will have some discussion with other engineers about it and keep you updated.

Regards,

Maxence.
activities.markdown_message:
Hello,

Thanks for your report, and I can confirm that this is currently the normal behavior of sharing a file to a group of email users via Circles.
Sharing to a Circle will generate a unique key/single share link that will then be shared to every mail address invited to the Circle.

I will have some discussion with other engineers about it and keep you updated.

Regards,

Maxence.

activities.message:
Hello again,

A descent solution have been found and I will work on this within the next few days!

Thanks for your report,

Maxence.

activities.message: Will the solution fix both problems? Password enforcement and user specific link tokens?
activities.markdown_message: Will the solution fix both problems? Password enforcement and user specific link tokens?

activities.message:
@michag86 : the 2 bugs will be fixed separately.

First, the tokens, as it's a bigger change.
Right now, we are using one token per share, stored in the table 'shares'. (let's call it `share_token`)
The idea is to generate our own listing of tokens per share (one per share and per member, called `member_token`) in our own table. 
The generated URL include the `member_token` and is routed by the Circles app and will redirect the member to the real share using `share_token`
When a member is removed, we change the `share_token` and remove the `member_tokens` related to that user.

For the password enforcement, I haven't had a deeper look, but it should not need that much work than the tokens. Hopefully.
activities.markdown_message:
@michag86 : the 2 bugs will be fixed separately.

First, the tokens, as it's a bigger change.
Right now, we are using one token per share, stored in the table 'shares'. (let's call it share_token)
The idea is to generate our own listing of tokens per share (one per share and per member, called member_token) in our own table.
The generated URL include the member_token and is routed by the Circles app and will redirect the member to the real share using share_token
When a member is removed, we change the share_token and remove the member_tokens related to that user.

For the password enforcement, I haven't had a deeper look, but it should not need that much work than the tokens. Hopefully.

activities.message:
_some updates_

first throw: https://github.com/nextcloud/circles/pull/326

There is no refresh on the token when removing a user, but we are using a personal token for each mail sent

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for your report again. This has been resolved in our latest maintenance releases and we're working on the advisories at the moment.

Please let us know how you'd like to be credited in our official advisory. We require the following information:

- Name / Pseudonym
- Email address (optional)
- Website (optional)
- Company (optional)
